corpname.value: Poly Archives & Special Collections at Bern Dibner Library of Science and Technology

unittitle.value: Guide to the Center for Urban Environmental Studies (CUES) Records, 1968-1975

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: The Center for Urban Environmental Studies (CUES) was an interdisciplinary program established at the Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn (now NYU-Poly) in 1967. In the 1970s, there were plans for CUES to construct a Fire Research Center in the Jay Street Firehouse. These records contain correspondence, receipts, brochures, newsletters, and articles.

p.value: Identification of item, date; RG-017: Center for Urban Environmental Studies (CUES) Records; box number; folder number; Poly Archives & Special Collections at Bern Dibner Library of Science and Technology.
Sources: Center for Urban Studies brochure, circa 1970 Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn course catalogs, 1967-1983

The CUES records contain departmental correspondence and receipts mostly in regards to printing promotional materials and brochures. These brochures are included in the collection as well as the CUES News newsletter and articles about CUES programs, especially joint initiatives with the New York Fire Department.

corpname.value: Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn -- Center for Urban Environmental Studies.
